segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate, and it’s like she’s in a trance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and it’s making me feel a little sick to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, and it’s just gross how reckless he’s being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so mad when she finally sees the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and it’s just going to make everything dirty and wet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s a complete mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will ever learn to be more careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and it’s just asking for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window is so bright, but it’s like no one cares about the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
